intro: Hieracium tephrophyton, commonly known as the tephrophytic hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium tephrophyton is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments, making it a common indicator species in certain ecological settings.
